title: Night
description: Beeldhouwwerk van de Nacht, een liggend slapende naakte vrouw, met opgetrokken rechterbeen waaronder een uil zit. Onder de arm een masker. Aan haar voeten een slapend kind. Naar het beeld van Michelangelo van ca. 1526–1531 voor het grafmonument van Giuliano de' Medici in de San Lorenzo (Sint-Laurensbasiliek) in Florence.

acquisition.creditLine: Purchased with the support of the F.G. Waller-Fonds

iconClassDescription: piece of sculpture, reproduction of a piece of sculpture

documentation: Raphael Rosenberg, 'Michelangelo's New Sacruisty and Vecchietti's Criticism of the Missing Attributes of the Times of the Day', in Stephan Koja en Claudia Kryza-Gersch red. Shadows of Time : Giambologna, Michelangelo and the Medici Chapel, Dresden 2018, p. 50, fig. 1.
longTitle: Night, Battista Franco (attributed to), c. 1550 - c. 1570

scLabelLine: attributed to Battista Franco (c. 1510-1561), after Michelangelo (1475-1564), engraving, c. 1535-1545

label.title: Night
label.makerLine: attributed to Battista Franco (c. 1510-1561), after Michelangelo (1475-1564), engraving, c. 1535-1545
label.description: Until recently, this engraving was completely unknown. On the basis of style and technique it can be attributed to the Venetian artist Battista Franco. In his early years Franco made numerous drawings after sculptures by Michelangelo, including his Four Times of the Day in the San Lorenzo Church in Florence. The printmaker added a sleeping boy to Michelangelo’s representation of Night.
